name: East Bay Pie
specialties: East Bay Pie Co. from Our Kitchen To Yours we offer frozen pies shipped to your door, providing a quick and delicious meal option. Established in 2020.  East Bay Pie Co was born from the minds of two long time Bay Area culinary industry colleagues. Rahul, one of the cofounders, was inspired by the Bay Area food scene, while Bill, the other cofounder, having grown up eating fresh produce right out of his grandma's garden, realized the importance of using local purveyors. Using their knowledge in the culinary world, they wanted to introduce a concept that provided customers with an array of flavors from all around the world. Made right out of their Emeryville kitchen, they utilize local vendors and top quality ingredients for their savory and sweet hand pies. They hope to let their customers experience the essence of different cultures through their simple, yet untraditional hand pies.

name: Berkeley Social Club
popular_dishes: Mascarpone Blueberry Stuffed Crunch French Toast
specialties: Contemporary full bar Korean Cuisine also serving American Breakfast and Lunch. Established in 2016.

name: Eureka!
specialties: Eureka! features an elevated collection of all-American fare paired with local craft beers, small-batch whiskeys, and cocktails making it the perfect place for for the local community to dine, drink and socialize. Established in 2009.  Eureka! is defined as expressing delight on finding, discovering or solving something... burger connoisseurs are discovering a better burger experience and Eureka! has elevated it to an art form requiring grace, finesse and sophistication. Acting with care ensures that efficiency never becomes haste and quality never suffers for convenience. Through thoughtful presentation of ourselves and our food, we show respect for our ingredients, our buildings, our guests and our colleagues.

name: Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen
specialties: Angeline's brings the flavor and atmosphere of a New Orleans neighborhood restaurant to downtown Berkeley, with great music, libations and the classic dishes invented in the Crescent City's greatest kitchens. We offer down-home classics like Gumbo, Jambalaya, Fried Catfish, or our Buttermilk Fried Chicken. For dessert, try our Bananas Foster Bread Pudding or our signature warm Beignets with chicory coffee. Whatever you try, you'll leave happy. Established in 2006.  Angeline's began as the dream of founder Robert Volberg as a way to bring southern hospitality and the delicious flavors of New Orleans to the bay area.  Inspired by the neighborhood jambalaya joints he had visited on a trip to the Big Easy six months before Katrina, Robert was looking for a location for his new restaurant when he struck up a conversation with a man in chef's pants in Oakland's Rockridge district.  The man was Chef Brandon Dubea from Baton Rouge, LA.  After working to develop an outstanding menu and create a delightful atmosphere, Angeline's opened quietly and gained popularity slowly after opening.  After reviews in the East Bay Express, SF Chronicle, Diablo Magazine and many others which hailed Chef Dubea's cuisine as 'authentic' and dishes as having 'real character', Angeline's was featured on an episode of 'Check Please, Bay Area'.  As word spread about the restaurant, Tempe Minaga completed the team as co-owner in mid 2008 to improve service and operations.

Located in the David Brower Center, the greenest building in the East Bay, Gather is designed to inspire community and educate people about food. Established in 2009. name: La Marcha Tapas Bar
specialties: With its rustic outdoor patio, pops of bright color and welcoming atmosphere, La Marcha is a restaurant in the heart of Berkeley that encapsulates the vibrant culinary culture of Spain. Visitors will feel as though they have strolled right off the streets of Spain and into an authentic neighborhood tapas bar.  Some Bay Area diners may recognize the duo behind this new venture. Chef-owners Sergio Emilio Monleón and Emily Sarlatte have gained quite a cult following for their incredible paellas, cooked at many events with their catering company Ñora Cocina Española. At La Marcha, the pair will continue to share their innovative take on Spanish cuisine in a space that offers a warm, lively local neighborhood vibe.  Spanish cuisine is more than flavorful, it is brimming with energy and passion. La Marcha's menu of tapas and paellas, coupled with a community atmosphere, reflect the chefs' shared passion for Spanish cuisine, and their desire to transport the lively tapas bar culture they both experienced in Spain here to Berkeley. Fusing the best of Spanish culinary traditions with the bounty of fresh produce and ingredients the Bay Area has to offer has resulted in innovative dishes, such as their renowned Paella Tres Cerditos--saffron and rice flavored with chorizo, smoked pork belly, pork loin, lima beans, leeks and apple cider. Established in 2015.  Some Bay Area diners may recognize the duo behind this new venture. Chef / owners Sergio Emilio Monleón and Emily Sarlatte have gained quite a following for their incredible paellas, cooked at many high-end weddings and local food festivals with their catering company Ñora Cocina Española. At La Marcha, the pair will continue to share their innovative take on Spanish cuisine in a space that offers a warm, lively local neighborhood vibe.

specialties: Gregoire is a high-end artisan takeout restaurant where everything on the menu  is meticulously prepared from scratch and cooked to order using the best local organic and imported ingredients from around the world Established in 2002.  On June 26, 2002, French-trained Chef/Owner Grégoire Jacquet transformed the tradition of carryout food by opening the first high-end artisan takeout restaurant - called Gregoire.

name: Via del Corso
specialties: A Destination ... is really just a place you are going along your way. When you enter Via del Corso, you may feel as if you are in any trattoria in Florence, Rome, or any other place in Italy. In the heart of North Berkeley, we bring you a place to relax, restore, dine and have drinks with family and friends. Leave the outside world outside for a moment. It is our pleasure to welcome you to Via del Corso. Established in 2008.  What would a Florentine Trattoria be like if dropped in the middle of Berkeley?  Chef/Owner Wendy Brucker spent her summers in Florence, her father a preeminent Florentine scholar.   Florentine cuisine flavors her love of food.    Chef Louis Legassic holds a mirror to the bold simplicity of the first little big city.  Local produce and meats transformed by Old World, time honored recipes and techniques: a neighborhood trattoria between Downtown Berkeley and the Gourmet Ghetto.  Dinner nightly.

Established in 2018.  Famous for Burnt Almond, The Lavender Bakery has been bringing the finest authentic European inspired cakes and baked goods to the bay area. name: Jupiter
specialties: Get off Uranus and go to Jupiter!  Jupiter is a multi-tap beer house that serves up to 12 house brews, plus 20 other regional craft beers.  Jupiter is known for its church-like interior, and huge heated two-level beergarden (complete with central fire-pit). Established in 1992.  Jupiter is the East Bay's most popular beerhouse, locally owned & operated, by John Martin (owner of Triple Rock brewpub just up the street and Drake's Brewing Company in San Leandro). Jupiter has been serving its own handcrafted beers & ales along with "award-winning" wood-fired pizzas since 1992. Housed in an old livery stable from the 1890's, Jupiter exudes a European atmosphere found in the heart of Berkeley, California. (The design was inspired by the oldest bar in Berlin.)

name: KoJa Kitchen
specialties: Korean and Japanese cuisines come together as one at KoJa Kitchen, the Asian fusion concept taking California by storm. We've set out to fundamentally change the way Korean and Japanese food is traditionally prepared and served, creating fun and delicious meals that are enjoyable whether you're an Asian fusion connoisseur or you're trying it for the first time. If you're hungry for a new and exciting way to enjoy Korean and Japanese cuisine, join us at KoJa. Established in 2011.  After finding success as a food truck known for pushing the boundaries of fusion cuisine, we opened our first brick and mortar in 2014. We're grateful to be able to bring delicious, unique eats to the San Jose community.

name: Third Culture Bakery - Berkeley
specialties: Gluten free Mochi Bakery offering foods and drinks inspired by our upbringing as Third Culture kids.  Mixing hyper local ingredients  like butters and dairy from Sonoma, California and coconut sugars from Indonesia.  Every pastry, food, and drink has a story to tell. Established in 2017.  Chef Sam and Wenter dated for 9 months before starting the bakery officially in April 2017 with just the Mochi Muffin - it was a 2 man show for the first 8 months, doing everything themselves from baking, dishwashing, delivering, invoicing, everything!  The bakery quickly grew to a team of 18+ full timers servicing over 60+ wholesale accounts throughout the Bay Area with their own Retail location in West Berkeley where they showcase the full Third Culture experience.    The bakery exists because of love and hopes to share that love one Mochi Muffin at a time.

We offer 8 Draft Beers focusing on local brewers. . We serve contemporary American Cuisine which reflects how we eat and cook in 2023- our heritage, the diversity of our culinary experience, access to farm fresh seasonal ingredients, artisanal products and our commitment to the community and environment. They have been operating restaurant Since 1988. Cafe M is there first partnership!

name: Sliver Pizzeria
specialties: It is Sliver's mission to use fresh ingredients of the finest quality as a means to empower the fight against global human trafficking.  One type of pizza is served in our restaurant each day, and we post pictures and ingredients daily on our website and social media platforms. We do this so our pizza ingredients are ultra fresh, as well as keeping your time in line at an absolute minimum.   We celebrate the diverse community of downtown Berkeley by supporting local musicians. Come enjoy a great selection of jazz, blues, hip hop, reggae, and more Friday and Saturday night at no cover charge!  Sliver has sincere compassion for human trafficking victims and zero tolerance for traffickers. We stay updated on the fight against modern day slavery and promote all efficient forms of abolitionism. Financially, we support organizations that are on the ground rescuing and rehabilitating victims, as well as those involved in preventative work. We are involved in community discussions on how to end slavery in this lifetime. Keep an eye out on our social media streams for who we are donating each month.  Like us to be involved in discussions about pizza, recipes, fresh ingredients, and how YOU can help in the global fight against human trafficking. Established in 2013.  SLIVER opened in 2013. We hope that you will not only enjoy SLIVER as a restaurant, but consider yourself as one sliver in our mission to contribute to a bigger pie and make it whole.

name: Belmo Cafe

name: Asha Tea House
specialties: There is a cup of tea out there for everyone, whether it's a simple glass of straight tea, or a crafted cup of flavored tea. At Asha, we strive to feed your love for tea by serving high-quality whole leaf tea and hand-crafted tea drinks made with fresh, pure and real ingredients.   We travel extensively to source teas directly from growers and make almost everything from scratch so that we know exactly what we're serving. We also purposely limit our drink and tea selections to showcase a small but comprehensive representation of what the tea world has to offer, and we make a big effort to share everything we're learning as we help build America's tea culture.      But we also know that drinking tea isn't just about the drink. It's also about where you drink it and who you drink it with--which is why we designed every element of our tea house to maximize your tea-drinking enjoyment. Established in 2012.  Responsibly-sourced artisan whole-leaf tea & globally-inspired hand-crafted tea beverages from house-made ingredients.  "Asha" is Taiwanese for "someone that enjoys life", and our hope is that drinking Asha tea will remind you of the things you enjoy about life.

name: Zachary's Chicago Pizza
specialties: Zachary's Chicago Pizza is 100% employee-owned with five locations in the San Francisco Bay Area: Oakland- Rockridge, Oakland- Grand Lake, North Berkeley, Pleasant Hill and Pleasanton. Recognized locally and nationally with over 225 Best Pizza Awards, Zachary's offers 2 styles of pizza: a Chicago-style stuffed pizza and a traditional thin crust pizza. Online ordering is available! Established in 1983.  Founders Zach Zachowski & Barbara Gabel grew up in small towns in Wisconsin. After living in Chicago for several years, they developed a taste for Chicago-style pizza. In 1983, they found themselves in the East Bay with dreams of opening their own pizza restaurant - with a California twist. Zach & Barbara opened the original Zachary's on July 25, 1983 in the Rockridge neighborhood in Oakland. Business took off immediately. To meet the growing demand, they opened a second store in nearby Berkeley on Solano Avenue just over a year later in 1984. Two decades later, Zach & Barbara began handing over the company to the employees. In 2006 Zachary's in San Ramon opened. Four years later in 2010 we became 100% employee-owned! In 2013 we opened Zachary's in Downtown Pleasant Hill. We celebrated 36 years in the Bay Area in 2019 by opening our second Oakland location in the Grand Lake neighborhood. Our most recent adventure was the relocation of Zachary's San Ramon to Pleasanton in July of 2021!

name: Mezzo
specialties: Mezzo is a casual eatery offering salads, sandwiches, and soups all made right in front of you, exactly how you'd like it. Known for our homemade ingredients and cheery environment, we have been here serving up our delicious honey wheat bread and poppyseed dressing since 1983. Established in 1983.  Mezzo re-opened in June 2017 after burning down in 2011. Since reopening, we have evolved and updated our name (formerly Cafe Intermezzo), but have kept our menu full of the classics.   The updated interior space includes modern touches while integrating some charming and funky pieces from the original cafe. Walking through the restaurant leads to one of the largest outdoor patios in the area with a bocce court and bean bag toss. Mezzo is fully connected to Raleigh's, the bar next door. Come grab a salad or sandwich then head up the ramp to pair it with a delicious local craft beer!

name: Julia's Restaurant
address: 2315 Durant Ave Fl 2 Berkeley City Club Berkeley, CA 94704
specialties: A contemporary, farm-to-table French restaurant influenced by California culinary cuisine. Inspiration at Julia's begins with the bounty of local and organic products available in the Bay Area and highlighted with French techniques. Combined with a beautiful atmosphere and friendly service, Julia's creates a memorable dining experience for all guests. Established in 2012.  Julia's Restaurant is located on the second floor of the historic Berkeley City Club. The building was originally opened in 1930 as a women's social club with private residences and dining room. The Club was eventually opened to both men and women in 1965 and changed its name from Berkeley Women's City Club to Berkeley City Club. Still remaining primarily a private social club for quite some time, the restaurant was finally opened to the public in 2012.

name: Little Gem Belgian Waffles
address: 2468 Telegraph Ave Ste A Berkeley, CA 94704
specialties: Order FREE deliveries on waffle bites! Littlegemwaffles.com Established in 2015.  Little Gem Belgian Waffles is the only Liege Waffle specialty shop in the bay area.  We handcraft our Liege waffles from scratch daily in small batches at our shop in Berkeley, CA.   Liege waffles originated from Liege, Belgium. It's made from a yeast-rising brioche dough. They are crispy on the outside, fluffy and moist on the inside. Belgian pearl sugars are baked into the waffle which caramelize on the surface as well as create sweet pockets inside the waffle. name: Abstract Table
specialties: Founded by chefs Andrew Greene and Duncan Kwitkor, Abstract Table at Cafenated Coffee Company in Berkeley, CA is a dinner series that offers conscious fine dining without boundaries or pretention. The menu combines Japanese influences with unexpected global flavors every Thursday, Friday and Saturday night. Abstract Table encompasses Greene and Kwitkor's philosophy of stepping outside of fine dining norms. This sumptuous yet affordable multi-course tasting menu is served in a simple, laid-back setting and features inventive, playful, colorful fare with an emphasis on fresh fish. Established in 2018.  Abstract Table, a fine dining experience without boundaries or pretention, continues as a dinner series at Cafenated Coffee Company in Berkeley, CA every Thursday, Friday, and Saturday night starting Thursday 7/2/20.  Chefs Andrew Greene and Duncan Kwitkor, who collaborated on the menu at Duchess in Rockridge and are veterans of Naked Kitchen 's intimate San Francisco pop-ups, offer a multi-course tasting menu that combines Japanese influences with unexpected global flavors.

We saw how popular similar cafes were doing across the continent and wanted to bring that experience to the Bay Area. name: Takara Sake USA
specialties: We are open every day: Mon, Wed-Sun from 12:00 pm to 6:00 pm. (last sake tasting at 5:00 pm) Tue from 12:00pm to 5:00 pm. (last sake tasting at 4:00 pm).    You can choose from a few different flights ranging from $10 to $20. Reservations required for Saturday tastings.  Takara Sake USA Inc., is a member of Takara Group, the leading corporation of alcohol-related business and biotechnology based in Japan. Takara has great experience in producing Shochu, Mirin, and Sake for more than one-and-a-half centuries.   Because Takara's main business endeavors depend heavily on the mastery of natural processes such as fermentation, the Company feels a strong responsibility toward preserving the natural environment. As a self-proclaimed "Harmonist," Takara engages in activities aimed at educating people about the importance of sustainable coexistence with nature. Its work in this area is embodied in Takara's corporate philosophy: "Contributing to the creation of a vital society and a healthy lifestyle for its members through our fermentation technology and biotechnology in a way that achieves harmony with nature." Established in 1983.  Takara Sake USA was established in 1983 in Berkeley, California. The main products produced in Berkeley are the "Sho Chiku Bai" brand of sake, "Takara Mirin" and plum wine. Takara Sake USA has taken pure snow melt from the Sierra Nevada Mountains and superior rice from the fertile Sacramento Valley. To this, they apply traditional sake-making craftsmanship and modern technology to produce a Sake worthy of the Takara mark. Various products like premium sake and shochu are imported from our parent company in Japan. We also have a unique Tasting Room and Sake Museum. It is our hope to introduce the public not only to different types of sake but also to Japanese culture.

name: Saul's Restaurant & Delicatessen
specialties: Since 1986, Saul's Delicatessen and Bakery has celebrated the vibrant, authentic Jewish deli traditions by creating a space that honors the old world and the new. Current owners Sam Tobis and Jose Mendoza rather than replicating the delis of New York, are creating a space that connects with roots all along the timeline of the Jewish diaspora. A space that draws from the old Ashkenazi European Jewish tradition, the Mizrahi Israeli tradition, and the new world of New York, Los Angeles, and Berkeley. For us, that meant starting with locally sourced, humane, and sustainable ingredients, house-made pastrami and corned beef, hand-rolled and chewy bagels boil/baked daily. So gather around a table in our large dining room, reminisce over old favorites and discover new ones. Established in 1986.  In the 1930's the Saul's building was a produce depot right off the railroad tracks. Since the 1950's, it has housed a delicatessen: First the Pantry Shelf, then Rosenthal's, and finally Saul's, established in 1986, in honor of Saul Lichtenstein. Saul and his wife Ginny liked to feed people. Saul held forth and Ginny cooked. Friends and family would gather with him to eat, talk with their mouths full, trade stories. We like all that. So come. Eat. Locally owned and operated.  Find answers to these FAQ's on our website!  - Are your meats hormone and antibiotic free? Are the animals treated humanely? - Why is this night different from all others? - Why does the pastrami and corned beef seem more expensive than at other deli counters? - What size should a deli sandwich be? - Are the meats Kosher? - Is Saul's Kosher? - Why isn't there a good New York deli here?

name: Acme Bread Company
specialties: Acme's goal remains the same today as in 1983 when the company was founded:  we strive to make the best bread that we possibly can. Established in 1983.  Steven and Suzie Sullivan founded The Acme Bread Company in 1983 to bake bread for restaurants and stores who wanted to offer better bread than was generally available on the wholesale market at the time.   Acme supplies bread to dozens of restaurants around the Bay Area including Chez Panisse, where Steven began baking bread in the seventies, as well as to scores of grocery stores and retail locations around the Bay Area.  When the bakery started up in 1983 we made only four different kinds of Bread: Pain au Levain, Sweet Baguettes, Upstairs Bread, and Challah. Relying largely on the requests aRelying largely on the requests and suggestions of customers, as well on our own occasional inspiration, we have expanded our product list over the last twenty-some-odd years to include more than 100 different products.  Since we began operation all our whole-grain flours have been organic but since the nineties, Acme has been incorporating as many organic and locally sourced ingredients

name: Uji Time Dessert
specialties: Japanese fusion style dessert  - Soft serve and parfaits including Matcha, sesame, tofu and other favors. - mochi ice cream with seasonal flavors. - Uji Time Ice Cream Established in 2016.  Uji Time Dessert opened its first pop up store in April 2016 and is known for its Taiyaki soft serve. The pop up was a great success because of its authenticity. Uji Time Dessert was the first dessert store selling taiyaki soft serve in the Bay Area.   Uji Time Dessert loves to combine and meld elements from multiple traditional desserts to create affordable treats for everyone. Our goal is simple - Think of Uji Time Dessert when you crave Japanese fusion style desserts. Uji Time Dessert regularly offers instagrammable, fun and delicious desserts and ice cream for all ages.  Uji Time Dessert has transformed itself into a full scale dessert cafe, from Fish Cone (taiyaki), black sesame soft serve, lychee ice cream mochi, Matcha Latte, Earl Grey puddings, to Hojicha and Genmaicha ice cream. Depending on the season, Uji Time Dessert offers limited production seasonal flavors, such as strawberry rose and lavender in soft serve or ice cream.

name: Endless Summer Sweets
specialties: Endless Summer Sweets exists to revive the kid in you, bringing back memories of the neighborhood fairs with family and friends. Endless Summer Sweets started in August of 2009 selling at festivals, eventually started catering there unique products. In February of 2016, the first store location was opened.

name: Beta Lounge
specialties: Beta Lounge is constantly evolving. We offer eight rotating taps, an expanding Belgian and craft bottle selection, great wine, sake and we now feature a full bar! Beta also has a tasty menu of small plates, sandwiches, paninis, pizzas and platters.  Our bottled beer selection includes Delirium Tremens, The Duchesse, Tripel Karmeliet, Alesmith IPA, Speedway Stout & Pale Ale, Rochefort 10, Old Rasputin and more! We are constantly changing our beer menu to reflect what is in season.  Beta is not loud and overcrowded like many bars here in town. We also serve food late every night.  Beta offers the best happy hour in Berkeley Mon-Sat 4pm-7pm  $1 off all draft beers | $5 well drinks | $1 off cocktails | $6 glasses of wine | sake specials  Weekly Specials: Monday | $2 off cocktails & Happy Hour all night Taco Tuesdays | $2 OFF tacos and $7 Margaritas all night Wine Down Weds | $20 Bottles All Night Brews @ Beta (Thursdays) | $2 off all Belgian & craft beers Established in 2009.  How cool would it be to own your own lounge? We're pretty sure that question has been asked by intoxicated friends since the beginning of time, but hey, we did it! We wanted a comfortable spot to have drinks, listen to music, and chat it up with the people of the East Bay, and most importantly create a spot that has been missing in these parts. Here we are...Beta Lounge.

name: Pizza Hut
address: 14501 San Pablo Ave San Pablo, CA 94806
specialties: Find your nearby Pizza Hut at 14501 San Pablo Ave in San Pablo, CA. You can try, but you can't OutPizza the Hut. We're serving up classics like Meat Lovers and Original Stuffed Crust as well as signature wings, pastas and desserts at many of our locations. Order online or on the mobile app for carryout, curbside or delivery. Established in 1958.  In 1958, two brothers borrowed $600 from their mom to open a pizza place in Wichita, Kansas. They named it Pizza Hut because their sign only had room for eight letters. How profound! Soon, the restaurant grew. Why? The pizza was awesome. The service felt like home. And the customers were treated like family. And we've been delivering that same food and service ever since. For the Love of Pizza Since 1958. From day one, the Carney brothers could look their customers in the eye and promise them the finest pizza in town -- because they knew the farmers who grew the ingredients, and they knew those farmers cared about quality. Since then, our farmers have grown right alongside us, and the ingredients we use are still our highest priority. No one loves pizza more than Pizza Hut. That's why pizza is in our name -- and always will be.

We bring you fresh and local ingredients with an innovative menu and excellent service. Established in 2010.  Our name itself introduces the food we bring to the table for our guests. Traditionally, guests are like Gods; therefore, we serve them the best we have.  From the top of the world to the tip of your tongue, Himalayan Flavors is home to the finest Himalayan cuisine!

name: Zachary's Chicago Pizza
specialties: Zachary's Chicago Pizza is 100% employee-owned with five locations in the San Francisco Bay Area: Oakland-Rockridge, Oakland-Grand Lake, North Berkeley, Pleasant Hill and Pleasanton. Recognized locally and nationally with over 225 Best Pizza Awards, Zachary's offers 2 styles of pizza: a Chicago-style stuffed pizza and a traditional thin crust pizza. Online ordering is available! Established in 1983.  Founders Zach Zachowski & Barbara Gabel grew up in small towns in Wisconsin. After living in Chicago for several years, they developed a taste for Chicago-style pizza. In 1983, they found themselves in the East Bay with dreams of opening their own pizza restaurant - with a California twist. Zach & Barbara opened the original Zachary's on July 25, 1983 in the Rockridge neighborhood in Oakland. Business took off immediately. To meet the growing demand, they opened a second store in nearby Berkeley on Solano Avenue just over a year later in 1984. Two decades later, Zach & Barbara began handing over the company to the employees. In 2006 Zachary's in San Ramon opened. Four years later in 2010 we became 100% employee-owned! In 2013 we opened Zachary's in Downtown Pleasant Hill. We celebrated 36 years in the Bay Area in 2019 by opening our second Oakland location in the Grand Lake neighborhood. Our most recent adventure was the relocation of Zachary's San Ramon to Pleasanton in July of 2021!

name: Taste of the Himalayas
specialties: We specialize in authentic Nepalese and Indian food. Our spices are homemade and we try to provide the best Nepalese hospitality. Established in 2004.  We had our first Grand Opening in January 2005.  Since then we have been known as the Finest Nepalese and Indian Cuisine of Berkeley.   We look forward to serving you!

name: Gioia Pizzeria
specialties: Creating a scrumptious pizza requires a delicate balance of ingredients and flavors at the perfect temperature. At Gioia's we have refined our recipe and technique for New York style pizza, making a pie that is simply delicious. You are sure to find our pies authentic, fresh and tasty. Come by for a slice! Established in 2004.  Gioia Pizzeria was founded in May of 2004 by Will and Karen Gioia. Located on Hopkins Street in North Berkeley, Gioia is nestled in a food-lover's paradise frequented by neighborhood residents partaking of the delights of the street. For Karen and Will being part of the community is essential. They feel that a connection with a community is ideal for their business, which they envision as a family run joint selling the thin crust, east-coast style pizza of Will's childhood, with a focus on the organic, sustainably raised local ingredients so ready available in California.  A defining childhood moment of Will's is going down the street for a slice and a Coke. Will wanted to bring that tradition to the kids of his Berkeley neighborhood, as well as working families and anyone who can appreciate grabbing a slice or a pie on the run, or sitting on one of the stools in the store watching the pizza makers spin dough and their neighbors coming and going.

Family run, personal service.   Contemporary causal ambiance with warm weather outside patio. Established in 1990.  .  Simple, straightforward, affordable Italian - made to order from the freshest ingredients and served in generous portions. This has been Pasta Bene's mission since 1990. Family owned and operated, we hope to become your "go to favorite" for lunch, dinner, and takeout.   Specialties include pizza from our Earthstone open-fire oven and house made tiramisu guaranteed to turn you into a regular.   Open 7 days a week with both indoor and outdoor seating, it is our goal to be equally inviting to Cal students, a lunchtime group of business colleagues, neighborhood families, or a couple of any age out on a fun filled date. We hope to see you soon.

name: North Light
specialties: North Light is for the people. Whether you're meeting a friend for a drink, cozying up solo to the bar, writing the next great American novel, or on a date, North Light is for you.  A plant-filled back patio with retractable roof, breezy parklet, and intimate book and record shop curated by some of the best living writers, musicians, and artists make us unique.   Our food is delicious and fresh; our drinks are ambitious but approachable; and our staff treat everybody with warmth and care. Established in 2019.  North Light is the lovechild of a rock and roll promoter and a published novelist. A little cocktail bar with a stunning back patio and heated parklet, it pairs fresh and shameless drinking food with award-winning, imaginative cocktails.

name: Delhi Diner
specialties: * Authentic Indian Cuisine * A varied range of delicacies and fine Indian cuisine from different regions of India  * An ever changing menu.   Meticulously prepared traditional and contemporary Indian cuisine  * Gluten free dishes  * Gluten free Naan breads * Fresh ingredients: local, organic, natural and sustainable.  * Halal meat  * Authenticity and excellent service * A receptive, warm and welcoming ambiance   Wide range of Vegan dishes and deserts Established in 2013.  The Delhi Diner is a culmination of the hard work and effort put forth by husband & wife team Krishna & Subhash and their beautiful daughter Aakanksha   Food & hospitality for us has been an adventure for over four decades. We take great pleasure in inviting you to discover our rich culinary heritage.  Delhi's cuisine in particular is an interesting potpourri of many regional Indian flavors and is  true reflection of  rich history and culture dating back over 5000 years.   Just like in Delhi, we strive to offer a varied range of delicacies and fine Indian cuisine from different regions of India in an ever changing menu.  Our meticulously prepared traditional and contemporary Indian cuisine is unrivaled and is truly capable of satisfying  your cravings for a great meal.  Every dining experience at the Delhi Diner is assured to define itself by authenticity, excellent service, delectable cuisine and a receptive, warm and welcoming ambiance. We look forward to making your visit memorable.

name: Little Plearn Thai Kitchen
specialties: Fresh ingredient everyday! Everything is homemade; curries make from scratch and they are gluten-free! Chili sauce is a must as we continue grandma (Plearn)'s recipe! Established in 1982.  Plearn has been a name in Berkeley for over 30 years! She opened an authentic Thai restaurant on University Ave. in 1982. After retirement, she has left her mark on many customers and mentored many in those years. Since 2000, Little Plearn Thai Kitchen has continued her recipes and influences. Her favorite curries and taste have not changed. We still continue to make curry from scratch, soups are made to order, sauce are from Thai herbs and spices. This takes time but we wouldn't have it any other way. That also means spice levels are out of our control! The fresh Thai chili produce we get every other day will determine the spice level. We hope you enjoy our Thai American family recipes!

name: Razan's Organic Kitchen
specialties: Razan's Organic Kitchen features organic green salads,freshly squeezed juices, and all kind of fruits and vegetables smoothies Burritos, International Wraps, and Combo Plates, using all organic ingredients and free-range chicken,grass fed  beef and wild fish, and is located in downtown Berkeley, on Kittredge between Shattuck and Fulton, near UC Berkeley campus's and  next to the historic California theater. Established in 1993.  In 1993 we started our first food cart at UC berkeley on Sproul Hall on Bancroft and Teleghraph St at the south side of UC campus, in 1997, we opened our permanent spot at 2119 kittredge st in Berkeley Ca. It is family owned and one of the first restaurant that promoted organic healthy food.our food is free of toxic pesticides,herbicide and industrial fertilizers, and all of our food can be prepared free of gluten if costomers chose to do so.We use CCOF and USDA certified organic vegetables, grass fed beef, organic chicken and fresh wild sockey, and coho salmon free of dye and antibiotics.

name: Sumo Roll
specialties: We serve the best sushi, Poke bowls, Teriyaki chicken, House salad, both veggie options and protein/meat options, both cold options and warm options! Welcome in to dine in or take out! Established in 2015.  We must admit, the sushi-burrito concept wasn't ours (that honor goes to Sushiritto in San Francisco). But we are happy to follow their lead....offering healthy and hearty 'sumo'-sized sushi rolls to the Berkeley area. Come visit us when you're in the area!

name: Marica
specialties: We are a family owned neighborhood spot that specializes in seafood, new American cuisine, and Asian fusion. Established in 2000.  Chef Owner Christopher previously owned the hot spot Christopher's Cafe in Berkeley on Solano avenue 30 years. 20 years ago, Chris & Nedda Cheung relocated to to the quieter side of College Avenue in Oakland. Since then, Marica is still a hidden gem of the East Bay. Marica focuses on exceptional food, great drinks at reasonable prices, friendly service in a fun casual atmosphere. Family owned & operated since May 2000!

name: Crepevine Restaurants
specialties: The Crepevine was built and created by our family to be a gathering place for families, friends, professionals and students. In our menu, you will always find something exciting to eat; and certainly, our youngest guests will never be disappointed. At the Crepevine we take great pride in providing the freshest, healthiest, ingredients we can buy, such as organic, fair-trade coffee, ocean raised Canadian salmon, and 100% natural beef that has never been given any antibiotics or hormones. Most of our fruits and vegetables are purchased from local farmers and growers. We use 100% Grade A pure maple syrup. All of our dressings and sauces are made from scratch in our own kitchen, including our pancake mix.

name: Agrodolce Osteria
specialties: Serving authentic Sicilian food only found in Palermo. From the creators of Trattoria la Siciliana. Outdoor seating. Full bar. Italian food with fully authentic, locally sourced ingredients. Seafood served fresh! Established in 2016.  From the family that brought you Trattoria La Siciliana--a fixture of Berkeley's Elmwood district for the past twenty years--Agrodolce is a sister restaurant located in the heart of Berkeley's Gourmet Ghetto. We are housed in a beautiful brick building that is equipped with a full bar and outdoor seating.

name: Cali Alley
specialties: House ground Brisket Burgers House braised Pork Belly Buttermilk Fried Chicken  Home of the Fat Cat! Established in 2020.  Cali Alley is the food window from California Rose Catering. After two weeks of quarantine, we opened on April 1st, 2020, right in the height of Covid19. We had no menu, no plan and idea what was to come. We simply put our heads down and cooked. We had to survive. Opening a restaurant in 2 weeks was what we did. Staying honest and cooking the best food is who we are. What a ride this has been. What great people we've met. Looking to see you at the Alley soon.

name: Townhouse
specialties: Welcome to Townhouse - an Emeryville staple since the days of Prohibition. Now serving tavern style Californian, with a Mediterranean twist. The newest iteration of Townhouse is still the place to come if you want to enjoy an amazing patio, fantastic service and food to fill your soul. Serving dinner, Tuesday to Saturday from 4p to 9p. Established in 1990.  Built by a local fireman in 1926 and immediately rented by a bootlegger named Blackie, Townhouse went from Speakeasy to brothel, to bar, to family restaurant known as Vernetti's Towhouse and back to bar again until its current incarnation, Townhouse Bar & Grill. Opened by Ellen Hope and French restaurateur Joseph LeBrun in 1990, Townhouse served up simple dishes in a rustic yet elegant space. Townhouse Bar & Grill had been Chef Ellen's pride and joy since 2002 when she became the soul owner and operator.   With 2020 came a global pandemic and the end of an era - Townhouse had to close its doors and Ellen has passed the torch onto a trusted and experienced team. Keeping in the tradition of comfort classics with an elevated  style, our new kitchen crew has created a menu that's fresh, local and serves as an ode to our cherished and storied history. Come and enjoy what the new team has cultivated at the old Townhouse.

name: Passione Pizza
specialties: Now accepting preorders for Valentine's Day 2022. Enjoy a delightful dinner and a glass of the finest wine with us at Passione Emporio - Celebrating love with a perfectly paired entrée and a twist! Established in 2013.  Master Pizzaiolo Fabrizio Cercatore opened the doors November of 2013 to what is his newest and most personal project to date, Passione Brands. Passione Brands- based in Berkeley, California combines the highest quality United States grown artisan flours and grains with the culinary traditions of Italy.   Passione combines deeply rooted Italian culinary traditions with California logic and fresh local organic ingredients. True to authentic Italian culture, Passione invites a modern audience to celebrate food as more than nourishment but as life itself. Art is the creative expression of life and Passione is where flour becomes art.

name: Cholita Linda
specialties: Cholita Linda focuses on Latin American comfort food made with love. It's our goal that every bite be filled with the tradition, flavor and warmth that makes Latin America so special. Our specialties are our delicious tacos, grilled sandwiches, salads and comfort plates.

name: Lemat
specialties: Come for  our Gluten-Free( yes, 100 % TEFF INJERA )and stay for the authentic flavors and Ethiopian hospitality.  Lemat Ethiopian Restaurant welcomes you to enjoy selection of mouth-watering vegetarian, vegan and meat dishes. Come and join us for the delicious food, warm-hearted hospitality, the ambience of early home of civilizations and traditional coffee ceremony. Established in 2016.  Lemat Ethiopian Restaurant and Café is named after a handwoven Ethiopian basket for injera, a large sourdough flatbread (heaven for gluten free dieters). Our vegetable, vegan and meat dishes are served in the form of wot, a thick stew, or tibs, a sautee of a grilled meat along with vegetables, served over injera.   To commemorate that the origin of coffee is firmly rooted  to  Ethiopia 's  history,  Lemat  also  serves  patrons  with  traditional Ethiopian  coffee ceremony. The displays in the restaurant are additional attraction on their own and tell the story of Ethiopia which many historians believe is the cradle of mankind.

name: Cornerstone Craft Beer & Live Music
specialties: Cornerstone is the East Bay's newest and most exciting Craft Beer Garden and Live Music venue.  Our main bar is over 50 ft long and has 42 carefully sourced craft beers and ciders.  Our live music venue has a brand new amazing JBL sound and lighting system, a VIP mezzanine and a capacity for over 500 music lovers.   Our interior is spacious 13,000 sq ft and has been designed by leading Berkeley architects.  We have a large patio with community tables and fire pits.  Our reasonably priced menu is based on rustic comfort food (available late March).  Our music venue also converts into a game room with ping pong, corn hole and giant janga.  Come join us for great beer, great music and good times. Established in 2017.

name: Triple Rock Brewery & Ale House
specialties: From its opening in 1986, Triple Rock has specialized in brewing and serving craft beer in a relaxed, classic tavern atmosphere.   On any given day, choose from a selection of 10+ handcrafted beers brewed on site. Some favorites include the IPAX West Coast style IPA, Red Rock American Red Ale, Black Rock Porter, Stonehenge Stout, Titanium American Strong Ale, Pinnacle English Style Pale Ale, and Dragon's Milk American Brown Ale, but make sure to check out the rotating selection of small batch specialty brews. Established in 1985.  Brothers John and Reid Martin (then ages 25 and 28), established Triple Rock in 1985. Triple Rock is the result of John and Reid's love for beer and brewing, as well as the love of classic American taverns (and dive bars). For Triple Rock, their idea was to create a place that would be simple and accessible to craft beer and classic tavern aficionados like themselves.  More than 25 years after brewing their first brew, John and Reid Martin are considered "founding fathers" in the brewpub industry, and have gone on to build a small empire of award-winning breweries and bars (Big Time Brewery in Seattle, Drakes Brewing Co. in San Leandro, and Jupiter in Berkeley). Still, Triple Rock remains their favorite. "It's where real brewpub beer began in the Bay Area," says John. "We feel lucky to have been there at the beginning of the craft brewing renaissance". Some say that you can see a little of Triple Rock in almost every brewpub.

Always made with local-sourced ingredients.    Catering available; Thank you!

name: Sweet Treat Stop
specialties: Sweet Treat Stop is owned and operated by Pastry Chefs from Le Cordon Bleu's Baking & Patisserie Program. We are currently the first and only mobile bakery truck in the Bay Area, baking "Fresh-On-The-Spot" Artisan Gourmet cupcakes and other sweet treats.  We cater weddings, birthdays, fund-raisers, corporate and private events. Our big pink and white plaid truck is a crowd-pleaser! The Sweet Treat Stop mobile bakery truck also features a state-of-the-art video/sound & intercom system which further adds to the overall experience of enjoying our delicious treats.

name: 1951 Coffee Company
specialties: 1951 Coffee is a nonprofit, specialty coffee company that provide job training and employment opportunities for refugees and seeks to educate the community about refugee life and issues. We serve high quality coffee and espresso beverages along with pastries from ThirdCulture and Firebrand bakeries. Established in 2015.  1951 Coffee was founded in 2015 in response to the barriers refugees faced in seeking, attaining, and sustaining quality employment in the Bay Area.

name: IB 's Berkeley
specialties: The best cheesesteaks, burgers, fries, sandwiches in Berkeley. A Bay Area staple for over 30 years!  Established in 1991.  Family owned Cheesesteak and Sandwich shop. We believe in serving premium quality meat at affordable prices. Our meat is grass-fed, pasture fed, and top quality!! We eliminated the greasy, messy cheesesteak and give you this delicious, top quality product on a delicious soft roll with cheese melted on top.

name: UC Botanical Garden at Berkeley
specialties: Established in 1890.  Our mission is to develop and maintain a diverse living collection of plants, to support teaching and worldwide research in plant biology, further the conservation of plant diversity, and promote public understanding and appreciation of plants and the natural environment.  The 34-acre UC Botanical Garden is one of the most diverse landscapes in the world, with over 10,000 types of plants including many rare and endangered species.  Organized geographically, the Garden features 9 regions of naturalistic plantings from Italy to South Africa, along with a major collection of California native plants.  The Garden was established in 1890 and its living collections are invaluable resources for international research and conservation.

name: AKEMI Japanese Restaurant
specialties: At AKEMI, we believe special occasions merit an exceptional celebration. That's why we've crafted a place where memories are made and excellence is served. Our menu focuses on what makes a meal truly great: the right ingredients and a chef's guiding vision. On our simple but exciting menu, traditional concepts meet fusion ideas using the best fish, the freshest local produce, and natural proteins, all for a uniquely flavorful experience. Pair with your favorite sake and enjoy your meal in our modern yet elegant dining room -- we know you'll savor every moment. Established in 2011.  We've been offering the Bay Area a place to celebrate everyday and special occasions alike since 2011. AKEMI is the latest incarnation of miyuki. Along with a revamped interior and exterior that includes salvaged wood and upgraded kitchen equipment, AKEMI features an updated menu spotlighting fresh ingredients and well-crafted flavors while retaining customer classics such as our sushi rolls.

name: The Campanile
specialties: Sather Tower, also known as the Campanile, is one of UC Berkeley's most beloved and well-known symbols. Visible for miles, the Campanile is the third-tallest bell and clock-tower in the world, and an integral part of the campus experience. Get a spectacular, sprawling view of the Bay Area from the observation platform. Tickets available at the door via credit card or Apple Pay (no cash or checks are accepted). Established in 1868.  The Campanile has been open for many years for visitors to enjoy the view from the observation deck.

specialties: Revival Bar+Kitchen was founded by Bay Area culinarians with 30 years combined experience in local, organic food. Brunch is bursting with excellent, satisfying Spring flavors and cocktails. 10am to 2:30pm every Saturday and Sunday!   Happy hour is Tuesday through Friday from 3:30 - 6PM. Dinner starts at 5PM. Established in 2010.  RBK sprung out of 16 years of earnerst, No-Cal cooking.  Chef Murray opened the Happy Belly in '94, and Venus in '00.   We are here to produce excellent, sustainable, honest cuisine.

name: Almare Gelato Italiano
specialties: almare specializes in high quality, artisan gelato. we make our gelato fresh everyday in the shop's laboratorio. we follow a traditional process of gelato making that allows our ingredients time to blend together, enhancing the flavor of each scoop. we don't cut corners with artificial powders or chemicals that better the appearance of the gelato but compromise the flavor. we purchase farm fresh citrus, strawberries and other fruit from monterey market in berkeley. we import our nuts from farmers in sicily and piedmont.   We are proud to be part of berkeley's established tradition of authentic, fine food. Established in 2008.  Almare Gelato was founded by Alberto Malvestio in 2008.  Alberto moved from the city of Treviso and brought with him the Italian Gelato tradition of his great uncle Dino, a true gelato legend.  Dino taught Alberto how to carefully prepare traditional delicious gelato. He also explained how cutting corners is just not an option when preparing fresh food.   Flavors such as the famous Toasted Almond and Caramelized Figs and the Lavender and Fresh Blueberries quickly became Almare's signature.  In 2012 Simone Arpaio moved from his hometown of Turin and partnered up with Alberto. With more ideas and a renewed energy Almare entered into the wholesale business and since then have been proudly providing high quality gelato to some of the best restaurants of the Bay Area.   In 2016 we opened our second location in Downtown Pleasanton where we can craft our gelato every morning like we do in Berkeley. Come visit us for a taste of real traditional Italian gelato!  Ciao

name: Way Station Brew
specialties: Open 7 days a week!   WayStationBrew Restaurant Coffee Bar Beer Garden DAYS: 8am-3pm Mon-Sat, 9am-3pm Sun. Kitchen closes at 2pm.  NIGHTS: 6:30-9:30 Wed-Sat. -Our Wagyu Smash Burger Menu!  Kitchen closes at 9pm.  A favorite Neighborhood Restaurant with fantastic Coffee & Beer.  Your daily Cafe and Specialty Coffee Roaster who cares just as much about delicious, quality food. Plus a solid beer selection. Win Win Win!  Way Station Brew is a hidden gem just off the beaten path of Downtown Berkeley -- Come fall in love. We are a coffee roaster's cafe and a restaurant with a sunny beer garden patio. Experience friendly neighborhood hospitality and a menu that is hearty and delicious. The cafe is warm and cozy and the beer garden is dog-friendly. For breakfast enjoy our legendary house-made scones, classic breakfasts and our customer-favorite fried egg sandwich.  For lunch our hot sandwiches and Wagyu Smash Burgers go down great with a cold beer... everything you need to unwind all day and everyday.  WayStationBrew - Find us on Instagram - Delicious, fresh meals for Vegans to Carnivores - $5 Mimosas - Famous Hot Scones every morning - Fresh Roasted Coffee In-House - Full Espresso based menu - Kyoto Cold Drip  Breakfast, Lunch, and Burger Dinner Menu, legendary scones and Firebrand pastry all to wash down with our house-roasted coffee, a variety of mimosas, a large selection of beer and delicious natural wines too.  Established in 2017.  That 's two years and a pandemic!  We thank you for your patience as we get back on our feet.  In 2017... A cook, a baker and a coffee roaster walk into a way station...   In 2020 everything went sideways but we 've held on thanks to a great community of friends, neighbors, family, and our wonderful and hardworking team!  We 're dedicated to building a better Way Station for all.    The setting is a charming brick building from the 1880's with a fantastic outdoor beer garden. A warm and inviting gem in a sea of cold, shiny and new.    Serving Breakfast, Lunch, and Wagyu Smash Burger Dinners. Plus our legendary scones and pastry along with our house-roasted coffee, beer, wine, mimosas and more.  Follow @waystationbrew on IG and keep up to date.    Way Station Brew is at the very intersection that sat the Dwight Way Station for the Shattuck Railroad Line in the 1890's.

name: Casa De Chocolates
specialties: Casa de Chocolates opened its doors in 2012 to bring the first Latin American inspired chocolate store to the Bay Area.  Since then, Casa de Chocolates has been creating unique, artisanal chocolates  and desserts inspired by a passion and love for Latin American culture, culinary sensibilities and aesthetics.  We make everything in house ('hecho a mano') with high quality, organic, and when possible fair trade ingredients.  Our gourmet pastries are made fresh everyday from scratch. They sell out fast so pre-order if you're able to.    Our pastries, bon-bons, and chocolate bars are perfect for corporate events, weddings, gifts or a staple in your self care regimen.  We also provide virtual chocolate tastings! Established in 2012.  Since 2012, Casa de Chocolates has been creating unique, artisanal chocolates inspired by a passion for Latin American culture, culinary sensibilities and aesthetics. Located in Berkeley, CA, we are proud to bring small batch ('hecho a mano'), high quality products to our customers in the Bay Area and beyond -- while also honoring the Mesoamerican origins of chocolate! Creative flavor combinations are at the heart of Casa de Chocolates' confections and desserts experience, including our award-winning Mole bonbon, as well as our Chipotle caramel, Tapatio, Inca Peanut Butter, Guayaba, Tequila butterfly, Flor de Cana mojito bon bons and much more to delight our customers.  We encourage you to visit our store in the heart of Berkeley's Elmwood District, or shop here at our online store. You can also discover Casa de Chocolates products at Napa Farms Market at the SFO Airport.

name: Tender Greens
specialties: We start with the best ingredients, cook from the heart and let our food do the talking. No compromises, no matter what. Sustainability is at the core of all the choices we make, from our food to our planet to the future of farming. It's in our DNA. After all, we're chefs. Established in 2006.  Two chefs and a foodie set out to change the way people eat for the better. Our inspiration? The meals we had when our friends came over. The food. The pairings. The exploration. The energy. And the promise that on any given day we'd eat or drink something we wouldn't find anywhere else. So we opened Tender Greens in 2006 and started a food revolution. Welcome to our kitchen.

Try one for yourself in Berkeley!

name: Larb Thai Food & Tapas
address: 10166 San Pablo Ave El Cerrito, CA 94530
specialties: LARB is an originating dish from the Northeast (Isaan) region of Thailand.  LARB is most often made with chicken, beef, pork, duck, fish or mushroom; flavored with fish sauce, lime juice, roasted ground rice and fresh herbs. The meat can be either raw or cooked; it is minced and mixed with chili, mint leaves, cilantro and onion. Traditionally, it is eaten with sticky rice and other Isaan favorite such as Papaya Salad, Isaan Sausage, Roasted Chicken, Bamboo Shoot Salad, Crispy Rice Ball, Grilled Chicken Liver and else. Established in 2016.

name: Mount Everest
specialties: Located in the heart of Berkeley,  we offer authentic, organic, delicious Indian and Napalese cuisine. Nepalese foods: Daal Bhat Tarkari, MoMo, Chowmein, Sekuwa, Choila,   Khasi Ko Masu(goat  masu)  Indian food: Chicken Tikka Masala, Palak Paneer, Baingan Bartha, Navratna Korma,Chicken Vindaloo, Lamb Curry, Fish Tandoori, Prawn Curry, and alot.  We also deliver! Established in 2010.  Mount Everest Restaurant is located at the place where there used to be Tandoor Kitchen. name: JotMahal Palace of Indian Cuisine
specialties: We opened our restaurant, we decided to do so with a recipe. The first step was preparing a location with personality where people would feel relaxed and welcomed. Step two was collecting organic ingredients to use in our favorite dishes that could create a menu Californians would be excited about. We then cooked these things together with our familial warmth until they were perfectly done and opened our doors in Berkeley. So, when people ask us what our favorite recipe is, we tell them it's the one that got us here. Whether you're a local foodie or a student at the university, everyone has a home at JotMahal. Established in 2016.  Mr. Gurnam Singh, the proud new owner of JotMahal, has been a chef for the past 25 years. Over the course of his career, Singh has prided himself on preparing fresh halal dishes for his numerous and recurring customers. His dream of owning his own place has finally come true with the opening of our restaurant in Berkeley.
